meanings.definition: To promote or appoint (someone) to a higher rank without increase of pay
meanings.sent1: The general brevetted the lieutenant for exceptional bravery.
meanings.sent2: The president brevetted the colonel for outstanding leadership.
meanings.sent3: The captain was brevetted to major, but his wallet remained the same size.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had been brevetted to a superhero after saving the day.
meanings.sent5: Being brevetted felt like climbing a ladder without reaching a higher rung.

meanings.definition: To confer a brevet rank upon (an officer)
meanings.sent1: The commander brevetted the sergeant for his dedication.
meanings.sent2: The king brevetted the knight for his valor in battle.
meanings.sent3: The brevetted officer joked that his new title came with a fancy hat.
meanings.sent4: The honor of being brevetted was like receiving a golden star.
meanings.sent5: The soldier felt brevetted like a champion stepping onto the podium.

meanings.definition: To grant a brevet rank to (an officer)
meanings.sent1: The admiral brevetted the ensign for his quick thinking.
meanings.sent2: The queen brevetted the admiral for his years of service.
meanings.sent3: The newly brevetted officer proudly displayed his new insignia.
meanings.sent4: The brevetted rank was a badge of honor shining brightly.
meanings.sent5: The officer felt brevetted like a knight receiving a medal.
